column1: Note: In Spanish phrase (Beginner level A1) , ""Estar"" is one of two verbs that mean ""to be,"" and is used for states of being and locations, as opposed to ""Ser,"" which is used for more permanent or inherent characteristics. Meanwhile, the infinitive form of the verb ""ver"" is used with an object pronoun to indicate who is being seen."
